questions.question: Where ……………………… your father ……………………?
questions.description: We use the simple present tense to ask about people’s jobs.

questions.question: My sister ………………………… plays for television.
questions.description: We use the simple present tense to talk about people’s jobs.

questions.question: …………………………. anything this weekend?
questions.description: We can use the present continuous to ask about arrangements.

questions.question: Call me when you ……………………. time.
questions.description: In subordinate clauses we use a present tense to refer to the future.

questions.question: Prices are ………………………… soon.
questions.description: We do not normally use the present continuous to make predictions about events that are outside people’s control.

questions.question: You will soon have an accident if you …………………………… on driving like that.
questions.description: In the first conditional, we use a simple present tense in the if-clause and will + infinitive in the main clause.

questions.question: I ……………………….. you a laptop for your birthday.
questions.description: We use the simple future in promises.

questions.question: …………………………. we go out for a meal?
questions.description: Questions with shall we or shall I are used to make suggestions.

questions.question: I will pay you back when I ……………………….. a job.
questions.description: In subordinate clauses we use a present tense to refer to the future.

questions.question: We ………………………….. the work by Monday.
questions.description: We use the present perfect to say that something will have been completed or finished by a certain time in the future.

questions.question: I can’t play because I ……………………………. my leg.
questions.description: The present perfect is used to suggest that a finished action still has its effect in the present.

questions.question: I …………………………. all my childhood in India.
questions.description: We use the simple past to talk about longer situations.
